def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    if not s:
        return []
    words = s.split(',')
    ret = []
    for word in words:
        if word.isdigit():
            ret.append(word)
            continue
        ret.append(word.strip())
        for x in range(len(word)):
            if word[x] == " ":
                ret.append(word[:x])
                continue
            if word[x] == ",":
                ret.append(word[:x])
                break
        else:
            break
    return ret

    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    wordlist = list(s.split())
    if len(wordlist) < 2:
        raise ValueError("words_string should not have a negative length")
    return wordlist

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    words = list()
    words.extend(s.split())
    if len(words) == 1:
        return words
    return words.split(",")

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    words = s.split(",")
    word = words[0]
    if len(words) == 1:
        return [word]
    else:
        return [word, words[1:]]

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is

    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    words = []
    for word in s:
        if word == " ":
            word = ""
        words.append(word)
    return words

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is

    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    words = []

    for i in s:
        if i not in words and i not in words + ',':
            words.append(i)

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    s = ', '.join(map(str, s.split(' ')))
    # split the string into words
    words = s.split(' ')
    return words

def words_string(s):
    """
    You will be given a string of words separated by commas or spaces. Your task is
    to split the string into words and return an array of the words.
    
    For example:
    words_string("Hi, my name is John") == ["Hi", "my", "name", "is", "John"]
    words_string("One, two, three, four, five, six") == ["One", "two", "three", "four", "five", "six"]
    """
    words = []
    for word in s.strip().split(','):
        if not word:
            continue
        words.append(word)
    return words
